trial_identification.studytitle: A Pharmacokinetic and Safety Study of the Chrono Nicotine Replacement Therapy System in male smokers.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pharmacokinetic and safety study of the Chrono Nicotine Replacement Therapy System in male smokers.

interventions.interventions: Nicotine Replacement Therapy System 6 doses of 6% nicotine formulation over 24 hours. Doses delivered at T0, T1, T6, T7, T12, T13 transdermally administered using the Chrono IDC 5 device through a patch. Pharmacokinetic analysis and skin tolerability using a 7 point visual scale will be used.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: PK analysis over 30 hours: blood draws at T= 0, 15 min for 3 hours, every hour through hour 16 then every 2 hours through hour 30.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety assessment with standard Adverse event evaluation and visual skin irritation and tolerability assessments at T0, T1, T6, T7, T12 T13 and T24 and T30 hours.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Safety assessments at T0, 1, 6, 7, 12, 13, 24 and 30 hours by verbal and visual assessments

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Skin irritation from device/drug placement and drug delivery. Skin irritation is evaluated with a 7 point visual scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Over T=0, 1, 6, 7, 12, 13, 24 and 30 hours, the evaluation will be conducted.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: infections opiate use consume more than 2 alcoholic beverages a day skin tattoos

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Phase 1 PK study with Descriptive statistics for Chrono Nicotine Replacement Therapy System (IDC-5) Including assessment of general safety
